Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the video shows skulls and bones kept in the Vatican, when in fact it was taken in a church in Milan, Italy.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video was not taken in the Vatican but in a church in Milan.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a misleading video and does not provide any evidence to support the claim of skulls and bones being kept in the Vatican.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video shows the remains of Israelites and saints of the Christian faith, without any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is provided by a commenter who shares a link to a Wikipedia article showing that the video was taken in Milan, Italy.
